name: df-hof
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, setvar s6
body: |- wceq(chof, cmpt(s0, ccat, cop(cfv(chomf, cv(s0)), csb(s1, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), cmpo(s2, s3, cxp(cv(s1), cv(s1)), cxp(cv(s1), cv(s1)), cmpo(s4, s5, co(cfv(c1st, cv(s3)), cfv(chom, cv(s0)), cfv(c1st, cv(s2))), co(cfv(c2nd, cv(s2)), cfv(chom, cv(s0)), cfv(c2nd, cv(s3))), cmpt(s6, cfv(cfv(chom, cv(s0)), cv(s2)), co(co(cv(s5), co(cv(s2), cfv(cco, cv(s0)), cfv(c2nd, cv(s3))), cv(s6)), co(cop(cfv(c1st, cv(s3)), cfv(c1st, cv(s2))), cfv(cco, cv(s0)), cfv(c2nd, cv(s3))), cv(s4)))))))))
comment: Define the Hom functor, which is a bifunctor (a functor of two arguments), contravariant in the first argument and covariant in the second, from ` ( oppCat `` C ) X. C ` to ` SetCat ` , whose object part is the hom-function ` Hom ` , and with morphism part given by pre- and post-composition. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 11-Jan-2017.)
